item.title: A set.seed() + ggplot2 adventure
item.description: Recently I tweeted a small piece of advice re: when to set a seed in your script: #rstats tip: always set.seed() AFTER loading ggplot2 pic.twitter.com/TLpdokbSlN â€” Lucy ðŸŒ» (@LucyStats) January 19, 2018 Jenny pointed out that this may be blog post-worthy, so here we are! Background âŠ• A little bit about where this tweet came from: I was out to lunch with my friend Jonathan â€“ over our scrumptious Thai food, he mentioned he was having some simulation trouble.
